MIT THINK.description: MIT THINK Scholars Program — a national STEM research competition for U.S. high school students. Finalists receive mentorship, funding, and an all-expenses-paid trip to MIT.

RSI.description: Research Science Institute — a prestigious 6-week research internship hosted at MIT combining coursework and lab research for top high school students.

MIT PRIMES.description: MIT PRIMES — year-long mentored research program in math and computer science for high school students. Includes remote option: PRIMES-USA.

ILO.description: International Logic Olympiad — global competition hosted by Stanford testing logical reasoning and proof-solving ability. Includes online prelims and in-person finals.

USACO.description: USA Computing Olympiad — national programming contests testing algorithmic problem-solving, leading to camp and IOI team selection.

AIME.description: American Invitational Mathematics Examination — selective 15-question exam for top AMC scorers, prerequisite for USAMO/USAJMO.

USAJMO.description: USA Junior Mathematical Olympiad — proof-based exam for high school students qualifying through AMC10 and AIME.

USAMO.description: USA Mathematical Olympiad — national proof-based competition for high scorers on AMC12 and AIME; pathway to IMO team.

SSP.description: Summer Science Program — immersive residential research program with tracks in astrophysics and biochemistry; students complete real-world investigations.

Simons SRP.description: Simons Summer Research Program — mentored lab internships at Stony Brook University across biology, physics, chemistry, and engineering.

NACLO.description: North American Computational Linguistics Open competition — linguistics-based puzzles exploring language and data structure; leads to invitational rounds.

USABO.description: USA Biology Olympiad — national bio exam sequence with theory and lab work, leading to IBO team selection.

USNCO.description: USA Chemistry Olympiad — rigorous theory and lab exams leading to international representation at IChO.

USAPhO.description: USA Physics Olympiad — exams and training camps leading to IPhO team selection; starts with the F=ma exam.

MIT BWSI.description: MIT Beaver Works Summer Institute — advanced summer tracks in autonomy, AI, and cybersecurity. Open to rising seniors who complete online prep.

Mathcamp.description: Canada/USA Mathcamp — a 5-week summer experience for mathematically talented youth with deep dives into advanced topics and problem solving.

PROMYS.description: Program in Mathematics for Young Scientists — 6-week number theory exploration hosted at Boston University, emphasizing rigor and discovery.

REGEN STS.description: Regeneron Science Talent Search — premier independent research competition for U.S. high school seniors; projects judged at the national level.

Conrad Challenge.description: Global innovation competition where student teams create market-ready STEM solutions and present at the Innovation Summit.
